text: Jean-Pierre Demailly (25 September 1957 – 17 March 2022) was a French mathematician. He worked in complex geometry. He was a professor at Université Grenoble Alpes. He was a permanent member of the French Academy of Sciences, elected in 2007. He was the editor-in-chief of the Annales de l'Institut Fourier from 1998 to 2006 and the editor-in-chief of Comptes Rendus Mathématique from 2010 to 2015. He was elected a member of the Academia Europaea in 2013. Demailly died on 17 March 2022 at the age of 64. ==References== Category:1957 births Category:2022 deaths Category:French mathematicians Category:French editors Category:Members of Academia Europaea
title: Jean-Pierre Demailly
